title: API Design Discussion - Authentication Strategy
description: Team discussion about authentication strategy for the new public API.
decisions: Use JWT for authentication with 24h expiry
Implement sliding window rate limiting (100 req/min)
Return RFC 7807 Problem Details for errors
Support both API key and OAuth 2.0 flows

summaries.phase1: Team identified requirements: must support both internal services and external partners, need audit logging, must handle 1000 req/min peak load.
summaries.phase2: Evaluated JWT vs session-based auth, OAuth 2.0 vs API keys. Discussed trade-offs between security and developer experience.
summaries.phase3: Decided on dual auth strategy: JWT for web clients, API keys for server-to-server. Rate limiting at API gateway level.

keyFacts: API will serve both internal and external clients
Must support webhook callbacks for async operations
Compliance requires audit logging of all auth events
Mobile apps need refresh token support

keyPoints.point: JWT chosen over session-based auth for stateless scaling
Rate limiting implemented at gateway, not application level
Refresh tokens stored in HTTP-only cookies for web clients

actionItems: Create OpenAPI spec with auth definitions by Friday
Set up rate limiting middleware in API gateway
Document webhook payload format and signing
Implement audit logging for auth events
